commentary.line: That's it from this game. There is a crucial encounter coming up involving Rajasthan and Kolkata. The winner of that game will be through to the playoffs. Switch tabs to follow that game. For now, goodbye and cheers..

Negi: "I am feeling very good. I was just trying to bowl in the right areas. He (Jadeja) is a great fielder and a good bowler, he took a brilliant catch. First time in IPL I bowled with a new ball, so I was a bit excited."
Pawan Negi is the Man of the Match for his figures of 2/25.

Dhoni: "I think it just gives you one extra match, if you have a bad game. We took it as another game and didn't think too much about it. The opposition was under pressure on such a wicket. That David Miller's catch was very important and Jadeja made it look easy. The great fielders are ones that make it look easy for the spectators. We have made it quite simple, we adapt, we improve, we have had the same group of cricketers. We are not like other teams who give chance to youngsters, but we groom captains. We have quite a few leaders in our side. The core of the side has remained the same and everyone has learned a lot over the years."

Bailey: "It has been a disappointing season. Hopefully the next year will be a better one. We haven't had anyone who has had a good season. We haven't got anyone in the batting leaderboard or the bowling leaderboard. You should not get too far ahead of yourselves. The good sides in T20s don't have much gap during their good and bad times. That is where we were poor. There have been plenty of positives, like some of the young Indian players have had a good season."

Earlier, CHN's bowlers put up a professional show and never allowed the home team to up the scoring rate. Pawan Negi picked up a couple of key wickets for the visitors. CHN ended the league phase as the table-toppers, while PUN were consigned to a wooden spoon finish.

Faf du Plessis and Suresh Raina played with a calm head on their shoulders to guide CHN to a facile win. Michael Hussey and Brendon McCullum were dismissed cheaply. However, Raina and du Plessis twinned caution with aggression and bisected the gaps with utmost ease. du Plessis then reached a well-constructed half-century. For PUN, Sandeep Sharma bowled a fine spell with the new ball. The hosts would rue the fact that Glenn Maxwell dropped a catch off his own bowling as Raina survived.

16.5   Anureet Singh to Raina, FOUR, CHN complete the formalities. They win by 7 wickets and will finish the league stage as table toppers. Full and outside off, Raina reaches out and squeezes it off the outside half to short third man, Hendricks misfields and allows the ball to reach the fence
16.4   Anureet Singh to Dhoni, 1 run, short of length around off, Dhoni steers it down to third man and leaves Raina to score the winning run
16.3   Anureet Singh to Dhoni, SIX, Dhoni wants to finish it off. Charges down the wicket, takes it on the full and hammers it over long-off for another six, the fielder leapt up but in vain

16.2   Anureet Singh to Dhoni, SIX, wow! Something that I have not seen from Dhoni. Short delivery on off, Dhoni shuffles a long way across his stumps, gets inside the line and scoops it over fine leg, it was rising steeply and he did well to get enough wood
16.1   Anureet Singh to Dhoni, no run, back of a length close to off, Dhoni guides it to backward point with an angled bat
Time-out
15.6   Beuran Hendricks to Dhoni, 1 run, fuller and just outside off, Dhoni leans into the drive, cover dives after the ball passes him
Round the wicket

15.5   Beuran Hendricks to Dhoni, FOUR, PUN bowlers keep bowling it short and feeding Dhoni, who keeps dispatching it. The slower delivery that is dragged short, Dhoni had all the time to pull it in front of square, no one protecting the deep mid-wicket fence
15.4   Beuran Hendricks to Dhoni, no run, short of length on off, Dhoni tucks it to mid-wicket with one leg in the air
15.3   Beuran Hendricks to Dhoni, no run, back of a length on off, Dhoni plays the short-arm pull to mid-wicket, straight to the fielder
15.2   Beuran Hendricks to Dhoni, no run, change of pace from Hendricks, Dhoni stays back and knocks it to point
15.1   Beuran Hendricks to Raina, 1 run, banged in halfway down the wicket, Raina pulls it on the bounce to long-on
Beuran Hendricks [2.0-0-19-1] is back into the attack
14.6   Anureet Singh to Dhoni, no run, yorker on off, Dhoni digs it back to the bowler

14.5   Anureet Singh to Dhoni, 2 runs, again, Anureet keeps it short, Dhoni has plenty of time to ride the bounce and pull to deep backward square, Hendricks runs to his left, slides and keeps it to a double

14.4   Anureet Singh to Dhoni, FOUR, Anureet drops it short and pays the price. No pace or the height to trouble the CHN skipper, he rocks back and pulls it behind square leg, split the two men in the deep to perfection
14.3   Anureet Singh to Raina, 1 run, dug in midway down the wicket, Raina swivels and mistimes the pull in front of square on the leg-side
14.2   Anureet Singh to Dhoni, 1 run, too straight, on middle and leg, Dhoni nurdles it to deep backward square leg and opens his account
14.1   Anureet Singh to Raina, 1 run, back of a length on off, Raina steers it to the right of backward point
Anureet Singh [1.0-0-4-0] is back into the attack
13.6   R Dhawan to Dhoni, no run, keeps it tad short and outside off, Dhoni guides it towards backward point
13.5   R Dhawan to Dhoni, no run, back of a length on off and middle, Dhoni gets inside the line and tucks it to short mid-wicket
13.4   R Dhawan to Dhoni, no run, full toss around off, Dhoni pushes it gently to mid-off, that should have been put away
MS Dhoni, right handed bat, comes to the crease

13.3   R Dhawan to du Plessis, out Bowled!! End of a fine innings. Dhawan has something to cheer about and so do the PUN supporters. du Plessis advances down the wicket and yorks himself, he can't keep it out and the ball crashes into the base of off-stump. The partnership is also broken, but it is a bit too late for the home side. du Plessis b R Dhawan 55(41) [4s-5 6s-1]
R Dhawan to du Plessis, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

13.2   R Dhawan to du Plessis, 2 runs, once more those strong wrists coming into play, back of a length on off, du Plessis stands tall and plays a whippy pull to wide long-on, Miller tidies up near the rope
13.2   R Dhawan to du Plessis, wide, Faf gives the charge and Dhawan bangs it short and outside off, too far for the batsman, easy call for the umpire

13.1   R Dhawan to du Plessis, 2 runs, short of length and on the pads, du Plessis whips it to deep backward square leg, nice use of the wrists. Sandeep Sharma does well to run to his right, dive and save a couple of runs
Rishi Dhawan [1.0-0-7-0] is back into the attack
12.6   Gurkeerat Singh to du Plessis, 1 run, another full toss from Gurkeerat, du Plessis drives to the left of the bowler, who gets a hand and parries it to long-off
12.5   Gurkeerat Singh to du Plessis, no run, leans forward and turns it gently to short mid-wicket, can't beat the fielder there
12.4   Gurkeerat Singh to Raina, 1 run, nice friendly full toss and Raina has mistimed it completely, heaves it to deep mid-wicket for just a single
12.3   Gurkeerat Singh to Raina, 2 runs, goes round the wicket, slants it onto the pads, Raina glances it fine and the batsmen scamper back for the second, Faf wanted the third but Raina says no

12.2   Gurkeerat Singh to du Plessis, 1 run, Faf registers his 6th IPL fifty. It is his first this season. The entire CHN squad are on their feet, applauding the effort. Slower and turning in, du Plessis works it with the spin to backward square leg. Raina walks up to his partner and congratulates him
12.1   Gurkeerat Singh to du Plessis, no run, tossed up outside off, du Plessis shuffles across and misses the nudge, is rapped on the pads but the impact was outside off
11.6   A Patel to du Plessis, 1 run, flatter and on the stumps, du Plessis milks it square on the leg-side and retains strike

11.5   A Patel to du Plessis, FOUR, Axar drops it trifle short, du Plessis uses the depth of the crease, goes right back and pulls it just wide of mid-wicket, who dived in vain. Miller can't get across from long-on as the ball races away to the fence
11.4   A Patel to du Plessis, no run, Faf comes down the track, closes the bat face and the soft leading edge rolls to cover
11.3   A Patel to du Plessis, no run, dabbed away to backward point, straight to the fielder

11.2   A Patel to du Plessis, SIX, fabulous shot! It has taken more than 11 overs to hit the first six of the innings. Faf uses his feet, meets the pitch of the ball and lofts it handsomely straight down the ground, pings the sightscreen on the full
11.1   A Patel to du Plessis, no run, quicker and on the stumps, du Plessis stays leg-side and pushes it to cover
10.6   Gurkeerat Singh to Raina, no run, slower and around off, Raina drops it wide of cover, wanted the run and was midway before Faf sent him back
10.5   Gurkeerat Singh to Raina, 2 runs, flighted from round the wicket, Raina comes down the track and chips it over the bowler's head, easy two. That was a controlled shot from Raina
10.4   Gurkeerat Singh to du Plessis, 1 run, quicker, fuller and on off, du Plessis nurdles it behind square leg
10.3   Gurkeerat Singh to Raina, 1 run, drifting down leg, swept to long leg, for a single
10.2   Gurkeerat Singh to Raina, no run, short and outside off, Raina cuts it late and straight to backward point, he is disappointed with himself for not putting it away
10.1   Gurkeerat Singh to du Plessis, 1 run, tossed up on off, du Plessis leans forward and works it square on the leg-side
Gurkeerat Singh Mann [1.0-0-12-0] is back into the attack
9.6   A Patel to du Plessis, 1 run, flighted and just outside off, du Plessis makes room and chopped it to the right of point for a single
9.5   A Patel to Raina, 1 run, tossed up and on Raina's pads, whipped away towards deep mid-wicket for a single
9.4   A Patel to du Plessis, 1 run, slower and just outside off, driven down towards long-off for a single
9.3   A Patel to Raina, 1 run, pushed through quicker as Raina charged down the track, he mistimes the heave and drags it down towards long-on
9.2   A Patel to du Plessis, 1 run, tossed up and just outside off, du Plessis makes room and works it to the left of cover for a single
9.1   A Patel to du Plessis, FOUR, Axar drops this one halfway down the track, du Plessis rocks back and pulls it high and over mid-wicket for a boundary
Time for the strategic break
8.6   Anureet Singh to du Plessis, 1 run, on a good length and well outside off, steered away towards third man for a single
8.5   Anureet Singh to du Plessis, no run, du Plessis comes down the track to a full ball and punches it towards mid-on
8.4   Anureet Singh to Raina, 1 run, fuller length delivery and just outside off, driven down towards long-off for a single
8.3   Anureet Singh to Raina, no run, on a good length and angling away from outside off, Raina gets his bat and pad forward as he pushes it towards backward point
8.2   Anureet Singh to du Plessis, 1 run, short of a length and well outside off, dabbed to the left of backward point. Maxwell fumbles once again and allows a single
8.1   Anureet Singh to Raina, 1 run, on a good length and on the stumps, punched down towards long-on for a single
Anureet Singh, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
7.6   A Patel to du Plessis, 2 runs, Axar gives this one more air, du Plessis goes down on his knees and laps it very fine, back for the second run
7.5   A Patel to Raina, 1 run, tossed up and on Raina's pads, nudged behind square on the on-side for a single
7.4   A Patel to du Plessis, 1 run, Axar drops one short and on the stumps, du Plessis rocks back and pulls it towards deep mid-wicket for a single
7.4   A Patel to du Plessis, wide, pushed through flatter and down the leg-side as du Plessis went for the lap sweep, called as a wide
7.3   A Patel to Raina, 1 run, this one is given more air, driven down towards long-on for a single
7.2   A Patel to du Plessis, 1 run, pushed through and on du Plessis' pads, worked behind square on the on-side for a single
A slip is in place
7.1   A Patel to Raina, 1 run, flighted and just outside off, Raina nudges it to the right of short third man for a run
Axar Patel, left-arm orthodox, comes into the attack
6.6   Maxwell to du Plessis, no run, the drifter from Maxwell, stayed a tad low as well, du Plessis backs away and chops it towards the off-side
6.5   Maxwell to Raina, 1 run, pushed through by Maxwell, Raina makes room and cuts it to the right of point for a quick single
6.4   Maxwell to Raina, no run, tossed up and on the stumps, Raina prods forward in defence

6.3   Maxwell to Raina, no run, Maxwell has dropped a dolly, this was flatter and just outside off, Raina went back and punched it to the right of the bowler. Maxwell went at it casually and with one hand, the ball hit his wrists and popped out, he can't grab the rebound as well

6.2   Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run, tossed up and well outside off, du Plessis gets down on his knees and laps it over the keeper. Miller gets across from short third man and keeps them down to a single
Back over the wicket
6.1   Maxwell to du Plessis, FOUR, flatter and on du Plessis' pads, he goes back and nudges it very fine. The man at fine-leg is very square, he puts in the dive but can't stop the ball
6.1   Maxwell to Raina, 2 wides, Maxwell tosses one well down the leg-side, Raina looks to sweep and misses, so does Saha, a couple of wides
Glenn Maxwell, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
5.6   R Dhawan to Raina, 1 run, too straight from Dhawan, worked away in front of square on the on-side for a single
5.6   R Dhawan to Raina, wide, short and angling well down the leg-side, left alone, called as a wide

5.5   R Dhawan to du Plessis, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, du Plessis nudges it in front of cover and calls for a quick single. Miller makes a direct hit at the striker's end, but Raina was well in. The third umpire has a look
Saha is up to the stumps
5.4   R Dhawan to du Plessis, no run, short of a length and just outside off, du Plessis shimmies down the track and mistimes the pull towards mid-wicket
5.3   R Dhawan to du Plessis, FOUR, that's powerfully struck! Tad fuller and just outside off, du Plessis comes down the track, plays the flat-batted drive past the bowler and into the fence
5.2   R Dhawan to du Plessis, no run, short of a length and angling into du Plessis, he was early in closing the face of the bat, gets a soft leading edge towards the bowler
5.1   R Dhawan to du Plessis, no run, on a good length and just outside off, driven to the right of extra cover. Miller is quick onto the ball, du Plessis wanted a single and is sent back by Raina
Rishi Dhawan, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack

4.6   Gurkeerat Singh to Raina, FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short from Gurkeerat, Raina rocks back and punches it through mid-wicket, the timing is sublime and the ball races away to the fence in a hurry

4.5   Gurkeerat Singh to du Plessis, 1 run, this was tossed up and on the stumps, du Plessis comes down the track, takes it on the full and drives it back towards the bowler. He deflects it away towards mid-wicket, the batsmen bump into each other as they cross across for a single
4.4   Gurkeerat Singh to Raina, 1 run, flighted and on the stumps, nudged in front of square on the on-side for a single

4.3   Gurkeerat Singh to Raina, 2 runs, pushed through by Gurkeerat, Raina went down on his knees and swept it hard, Bailey dives at backward square leg, gets a hand onto it and saves a couple of runs

4.2   Gurkeerat Singh to Raina, FOUR, that's nicely played by Raina, shimmied down the track, got too close to the pitch but goes through with the lofted on-drive, clears mid-on and races away to the fence
4.1   Gurkeerat Singh to Raina, no run, tossed up and on the off-stump line, pushed towards mid-on
Gurkeerat Singh Mann, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
3.6   Beuran Hendricks to Raina, 1 run, fraction too short and too straight from Hendricks, worked behind square on the on-side for a single

3.5   Beuran Hendricks to du Plessis, 3 runs, that was close! A half-hearted pull from du Plessis, manages to bisect the gap between mid-on and mid-wicket, Gurkeerat gives the chase and keeps them down to three runs
3.4   Beuran Hendricks to Raina, 1 run, back of a length and in that channel outside off, steered away towards third man for a single
3.4   Beuran Hendricks to Raina, wide, the bouncer from Hendricks, Raina shuffled across on the pull and missed, it was close to the gloves and is harshly called as a wide
3.3   Beuran Hendricks to du Plessis, 1 run, tad fuller and on the off-stump line, dabbed with an open face towards third man, just a single
3.2   Beuran Hendricks to du Plessis, no run, back of a length and just outside off, du Plessis dabs it with an open face towards backward point
3.1   Beuran Hendricks to du Plessis, FOUR, width on offer from Hendricks, du Plessis stands tall and punches it square past cover, no need to run for those
2.6   Sandeep Sharma to Raina, no run, back of a length and just outside off, Raina gets behind the line and defends it

2.5   Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, lovely shot, fraction short of a length and just outside off, Raina leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and pushes it through extra cover for a boundary
2.4   Sandeep Sharma to Raina, 2 runs, short of a length and on Raina's pads, worked away in front of square on the on-side for a couple of runs
2.3   Sandeep Sharma to Raina, no run, fuller length delivery and on the stumps, whipped away straight to Bailey at mid-wicket
2.2   Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, 1 run, short of a length and on du Plessis' pads, tucked away past square leg for a single
2.1   Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, no run, fuller length delivery and shaping away from outside off, left alone

1.6   Beuran Hendricks to Raina, no run, fuller length delivery and well outside off, Raina leans forward and caresses it towards extra cover. The fielder fumbles but Gurkeerat was backing him up at mid-off
Suresh Raina, left handed bat, comes to the crease

1.5   Beuran Hendricks to Brendon McCullum, out Bowled!! CHN have lost both openers now. This was banged in short and angled across the right-hander, McCullum was hopping across as he looked to nudge it down towards third man, he played with an angled bat and the inside edge is found, the off-stump is rattled and McCullum walks away for the final time in this season's IPL. Brendon McCullum b Beuran Hendricks 6(6) [4s-1]
Beuran Hendricks to Brendon McCullum, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

1.4   Beuran Hendricks to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, top-edge and four, Hendricks drops one short as McCullum gave the charge, he throws the bat at that and gets a thick top-edge. The third man was inside the ring and the ball goes over his head and into the fence
1.3   Beuran Hendricks to Brendon McCullum, no run, short of a length and shaping away from outside off, McCullum drops his wrists and lets it go

1.2   Beuran Hendricks to du Plessis, 3 runs, tad too straight from Hendricks, ends up drifting onto du Plessis' pads, worked away in front of square on the on-side. Gurkeerat gives the chase and pulls the ball back in before the ropes, du Plessis is off and running with three
1.1   Beuran Hendricks to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, dabbed in front of cover for a quick single
Beuran Hendricks, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Faf du Plessis, right handed bat, comes to the crease

0.6   Sandeep Sharma to M Hussey, out Caught by W Saha!! Edged and caught! Not a happy comeback for Hussey, tad fuller and slanting across the left-hander, Hussey was pushing forward from the crease, gets a thick edge through to the keeper. PUN needed early wickets and Sandeep has provided them one in the first over of the innings. M Hussey c W Saha b Sandeep Sharma 1(4)
Sandeep Sharma to M Hussey, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
0.5   Sandeep Sharma to M Hussey, no run, on a good length and in that channel outside off, defended back towards the bowler
0.4   Sandeep Sharma to M Hussey, no run, on a good length and on the off-stump line, Hussey watchfully defends it towards mid-wicket
0.3   Sandeep Sharma to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, fraction too straight from Sandeep, worked behind square on the on-side for a single
0.2   Sandeep Sharma to Brendon McCullum, no run, short of a length and just outside off, McCullum is cramped for room as this one nipped back in, chopped straight to the fielder at backward point
Saha is up to the stumps for McCullum

0.1   Sandeep Sharma to M Hussey, 1 run, fuller length delivery and shaping away from outside off, draws Hussey into the drive, the edge is found but there's no second slip. Hussey is off and running with a single
M Hussey and Brendon McCullum are at the crease. M Hussey is on strike. Sandeep Sharma will open the attack
A slip in place for Sandeep
Welcome back.. A new opening partnership for CHN. Michael Hussey is batting for the first time in this season. Can PUN defend 130?

Jadeja: "It was a good change from the skipper (starting with Negi). Everybody bowled pretty well. Now we have to bat sensibly and chase it down. If we play normal cricket, we should win it. The skipper told me to be ready and I knew he was going to hit it there (referring to Miller's catch). This is a crucial game for us as we need to finish in the top two."
The deck is surprisingly offering turn, however, the hosts have to play out of their skins to upset the apple-cart and register a consolation victory.

All of CHN's bowlers chipped in with wickets to restrict the home team to a modest total. In fact, none of PUN's batsmen made an impact. For the visitors, Pawan Negi snared two wickets. Ashish Nehra and Ravichandran Ashwin also bowled well and were rewarded with wickets. Only Axar Patel made his presence felt in the slog overs by playing with a calm head on his shoulders.

19.6   Nehra to R Dhawan, 1 run, shortish and around off, Dhawan clears his front leg and pulls to deep mid-wicket, Hendricks wanted the second but is sent back, he just makes it in as the throw comes to his end

19.5   Nehra to R Dhawan, SIX, Nehra misses the yorker and is dispatched into the crowd. Nice juicy full toss, Dhawan kneels down, picks his spot and hammers it flat and over wide long-on. That was hit pretty hard
19.4   Nehra to R Dhawan, no run, too full and on the stumps, Dhawan makes room and squeezes the drive to mid-off, doesn't risk taking the run
19.3   Nehra to R Dhawan, no run, bouncer following the batsman, Dhawan backs away and can't connect with the pull, he got into all tangle while trying to play that
19.2   Nehra to Beuran Hendricks, 1 run, banged in short and outside off, Hendricks flat-bats it over extra cover, Bravo from mid-off tidies up
19.1   Nehra to Beuran Hendricks, no run, back of a length just outside off, Hendricks tries the steer down to third man, fails to connect
Ashish Nehra [2.0-0-9-1] is back into the attack
Beuran Hendricks, right handed bat, comes to the crease

18.6   Dwayne Bravo to A Patel, out Caught by Dhoni!! Wicket No. 20 for Bravo. It was once again the slower delivery that deceives the batsman. Bravo bowled it well wide of off, Axar reaches out, looks to go leg-side, the top-edge goes straight up and to the left of MS, who calls for it and takes it calmly. A good innings from Axar comes to an end. A Patel c Dhoni b Dwayne Bravo 32(29) [4s-2 6s-1]
Dwayne Bravo to A Patel, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
18.5   Dwayne Bravo to R Dhawan, 1 run, full and on the stumps, Dhawan charges down and squeezes the drive to long-on

18.4   Dwayne Bravo to R Dhawan, SIX, hammered! Bravo was too predictable. Another off-speed delivery, Dhawan shimmies down the wicket, spots the slower one and smashes it with the turn over wide long-on for the second six of the over
18.3   Dwayne Bravo to A Patel, 1 run, low full toss just outside off, Axar backs away to the leg-side, toe-ends the drive to long-off
18.2   Dwayne Bravo to A Patel, no run, fired full and well wide of off, Axar makes room and can't reach it, that was just inside the tramline

18.1   Dwayne Bravo to A Patel, SIX, wow! What an effort from Faf. Slower ball just outside off, Axar drags the loft towards long-on, got plenty of wood to clear the rope. Faf leapt up, went with his right-hand, but the ball eludes him. Even if he had saved the six, it would have been a top effort
17.6   Ravindra Jadeja to A Patel, 1 run, tossed up on off, Axar kneels down and sweeps it to deep backward square leg, Negi does well to keep it down to a single

17.5   Ravindra Jadeja to A Patel, FOUR, full, quick and in the slot, Axar clears his front leg and tonks it over the non-striker's head, one bounce and into the fence. No chance for the long-on fielder to stop that
17.4   Ravindra Jadeja to R Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan takes a couple of steps out of the crease, Jadeja drags the length back, dabbed to backward point
17.3   Ravindra Jadeja to A Patel, 1 run, right in the blockhole, Axar digs it out to long-on

17.2   Ravindra Jadeja to A Patel, no run, Axar comes down the track and slaps it to extra cover, Hussey dives and stops the ball, Axar wanted the run and was halfway down, but Hussey is slow to release the ball
17.1   Ravindra Jadeja to R Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, pushed through on leg-stump, Dhawan misses the nudge, wears it on the pad and the ball dribbles to the off-side, Axar calls for a quick single
Ravindra Jadeja [2.0-0-11-1] is back into the attack
16.6   Dwayne Bravo to R Dhawan, 1 run, nice loopy off-cutter to end the over, Dhawan bends down and swipes it to long-on, for a single
16.5   Dwayne Bravo to A Patel, 1 run, shortish and around off, Axar plays the short-arm pull to deep mid-wicket, Hussey tidies up
16.4   Dwayne Bravo to R Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan gives the charge, almost yorks himself, squeezes it to long-on
16.3   Dwayne Bravo to A Patel, 1 run, back of a length just outside off, Axar punches to sweeper cover
16.2   Dwayne Bravo to R Dhawan, 1 run, off-cutter just outside off, Dhawan drops it in front of backward point, easy single taken
16.1   Dwayne Bravo to A Patel, 1 run, fuller and outside off, Axar toe-ends the drive past the diving extra cover fielder, the man at sweeper backs up
Dwayne Bravo, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
15.6   Negi to R Dhawan, no run, slower and around off, Dhawan defends with an open bat face to backward point
15.5   Negi to R Dhawan, no run, touch quicker and just outside off, Dhawan guides it to short third, he wanted the run but is sent back
15.4   Negi to R Dhawan, 2 runs, shortish and turning away, Dhawan backs away and dabs it wide of the slip fielder, Jaddu gives chase and keeps it to a couple
15.3   Negi to R Dhawan, no run, floated up outside off, Dhawan drives and finds Baz at cover

15.2   Negi to R Dhawan, FOUR, good shot! PUN need plenty more of this, if they have to put up a respectable score on the board. Tossed up on off, Dhawan kneels down and sweeps it in front of square, beats the fielder at deep mid-wicket with ease
15.1   Negi to A Patel, 1 run, flighted outside off, Axar skips out of the crease and drives to long-off
15.1   Negi to A Patel, wide, turning down leg, Axar fails to get bat on the glance, extra added to the total
Time-out
14.6   Raina to A Patel, 1 run, flatter and around off, punched down to long-off, retains strike with that single
14.5   Raina to A Patel, FOUR, super shot! Axar uses his feet, almost yorks himself, but manages to whip it between deep mid-wicket and long-on, the fielder in the deep had no chance of stopping that
14.4   Raina to R Dhawan, 1 run, fraction short and outside off, Dhawan cuts it to sweeper cover
14.3   Raina to R Dhawan, no run, pushed through just outside off, Dhawan leans forward and knocks it to cover
14.2   Raina to R Dhawan, no run, slower and turns back in, Dhawan dabs it past the keeper, he wanted the run but Axar sends him back
14.1   Raina to A Patel, 1 run, drifting onto the pads, nurdled away to square leg, for a single
14.1   Raina to A Patel, wide, darted down the leg-side, easy call for the umpire
Suresh Raina, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
13.6   Negi to R Dhawan, no run, slower on off and middle, Dhawan stays back and drops it to the off-side

Negi drops it short, Miller goes leg-side and nails the pull, it was hit flat and to the left of deep mid-wicket, Jaddu dived full length and pulls off a spectacular catch. Even gets an applause from Dhoni. CHN continue to take some terrific catches. D Miller c Ravindra Jadeja b Negi 11(15) [4s-1]
Negi to D Miller, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
13.4   Negi to A Patel, 1 run, slower through the air, Axar comes down the track and nudges it to square leg

12.5   Ashwin to A Patel, 1 run, pushed through on middle, Axar jams it square of the wicket on the leg-side, he was almost beaten for pace there

12.4   Ashwin to A Patel, no run, very well bowled, gives this plenty of air and invites the batsman to drive, Axar obliges and goes for the booming drive, the ball turns past the outside edge and MS whips the bails off. Axar had dragged his foot out, but made it back in time
Third umpire called in for a stumping check. No issuses with Ashwin's front foot. Axar has made it in. He survives!
12.3   Ashwin to D Miller, 1 run, slower and outside off, Miller had to wait for it and paddles it to square leg

11.2   Ravindra Jadeja to D Miller, 1 run, uses his feet, doesn't get to the pitch, manages to nudge it to deep mid-wicket

The magic spray would probably take the pain away

2.5   Negi to Bailey, FOUR, that's a poor, poor ball from Negi. It was flatter and on the leg stump line, Bailey swivels and pulls it to the left of short fine leg, who had no chance of stopping that and Bailey collects four

Negi to W Saha, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
2.1   Negi to W Saha, 2 runs, drags this one short, Saha rocks back and pulls it through mid-wicket, the batsmen take a couple before the fielder in the deep runs to his left and stops the ball

1.5   I Pandey to W Saha, SIX, short delivery from Pandey and Saha takes full toll of it, he had enough room there to free his arms as he muscles the pull over the deep mid-wicket fence for the first maximum of the innings

There is a slip in place for Pandey
Ishwar Pandey, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
0.6   Negi to Vohra, no run, flighted delivery on off stump line, Vohra wristily works it to mid-on

0.4   Negi to W Saha, FOUR, first boundary for Saha, it was a shortish delivery and there was enough width on offer for Saha to go back, he cuts it up and over the fielder at cover, the ball runs away to the deep extra cover fence
0.3   Negi to W Saha, no run, touch quicker and around off, Saha mistimes the drive to cover
0.2   Negi to W Saha, no run, floated up on off, Saha leans forward and drives it straight to cover
0.1   Negi to W Saha, no run, flatter and just outside off, Saha punches it towards cover-point
W Saha and Vohra are at the crease. W Saha is on strike. Negi will open the attack

CHN players break out of the huddle and are making their way out to the middle, followed by PUN's openers. Negi will start the proceedings. Saha will be on strike first up. There is a slip in place. Here we go then...
Teams:
Chennai (Playing XI): Brendon McCullum, Michael Hussey, Suresh Raina, Faf du Plessis, MS Dhoni(w/c), Dwayne Bravo, Pawan Negi, Ravindra Jadeja, Ravichandran Ashwin, Ishwar Pandey, Ashish Nehra
Punjab (Playing XI): Wriddhiman Saha(w), Manan Vohra, Glenn Maxwell, David Miller, George Bailey(c), Axar Patel, Gurkeerat Singh Mann, Rishi Dhawan, Beuran Hendricks, Anureet Singh, Sandeep Sharma

Dhoni: "You want to top the table, because it gives you the extra chance if you have a bad day or an individual in the opposition ranks has a great day. We will try to focus on the process. If we win, we win or we will have to grind it out like we normally do. We have made a couple of changes, Doctor (Dwayne) Smith is not playing today, Hussey comes in and Ashish Nehra is fit and back in place of Mohit."

Bailey: "I am going to bat. It was nice, we obviously worked hard. We didn't have much to show for a few weeks, but it was good to get some reward the last time around. We'll try and play the same way. That can give us a bit of momentum for next year. We want to finish on a high, beating a team that are already through. We have the same eleven."
Punjab have won the toss and have opted to bat
Toss and the team news are not far away. Stay tuned.

Team News: With Brendon McCullum set to leave for national duty, it will be interesting to see if CHN give Michael Hussey a chance before the playoffs. McCullum's form has been instrumental for CHN's success this season and CHN might play him one last time, considering the top position is at stake. At the same time, Hussey hasn't played a game yet in this year's IPL and making him play directly in the playoffs could well turn out to be risky. PUN though might be willing to give a few Indian youngsters an opportunity to showcase their talent today.

CHN's last outing was an affair to forget. Playing against the seventh placed Delhi, CHN's batting failed miserably and they could only muster 119 runs in 20 overs. In reply, Shreyas Iyer and Yuvraj Singh starred with the bat and helped the Delhi win by 6 wickets. CHN though are a formidable unit and it will be a mistake to count them out because of a loss in their last game.

In their last game against BLR, PUN showed us why they can't be taken lightly even though they are languishing at the bottom of the table. In a game curtailed by rain, PUN managed to score 106 runs in their 10 overs. Their bowlers then came to the party as they restricted a strong BLR batting line-up to 84/6, winning the game by 22 runs.

CHN though have other things to look forward to. If they win today, they will move to 18 points and that will cement their place at the top of the points table, meaning they'll get two chances to reach the final this time around. On the other hand, PUN are playing for some pride and they wouldn't mind finishing their disappointing season on a high.

After a humdinger last night in Hyderabad, the IPL bandwagon now moves to Mohali, where the two Kings - Punjab and Chennai, will lock horns in their final league game. CHN have already qualified for the playoffs, while PUN have already been confirmed as the wooden spoon holders. Hello and a warm welcome to Match 53 of the Indian Premier League.

Preview:
Amidst the hubbub of teams scampering for a play-off berth, Chennai and Punjab have a sense of serenity about them. And that is because they are not in the 11th hour race to make the cutoff. While MS Dhoni's men have been assured of a place in the final four for the eighth successive season, Punjab, last season's losing finalists, face the ignominy of ending up with the wooden spoon.

The clash at Mohali will, however, be significant in the larger scheme of things for the Chennai who'd dearly want to seal a spot in the top-two, a standing that would give them the luxury of a second chance at making the final should they falter in the first qualifier. Punjab, following their shock defeat of Bangalore, also have the incentive of ending, what has been a disastrous campaign, on a high.

Venue: Punjab Cricket Association Stadium, Mohali

Date: May 16, 2015

Time: 16:00 IST

Weather: Dry and sunny with a high of 41 degree Celsius.

Team News:

Punjab

Punjab experimented with Wriddhiman Saha in the opening slot to great effect against the Bangalore and will be tempted to play the same opening combination in a full game. That move should allow Glenn Maxwell, who has a fine record against the men in yellow, to take up his favoured No. 3 slot, a position that is expected to rekindle happier memories for the Australian. Meanwhile, Beuran Hendricks' bowling effort from two nights ago may just edge Thissara Perera out.

Probable XI:

Manan Vohra, Wriddhiman Saha (wk), Glenn Maxwell, David Miller, George Bailey (c), Axar Patel, Gurkeerat Singh Mann, Rishi Dhawan, Beuran Hendricks, Anureet Singh, Sandeep Sharma

Chennai

Not known to chop and change too much, Chennai will be expected to field a largely similar team. Ashish Nehra is likely to return in place of Ishwar Pandey after missing the game against Delhi with the flu. The think-tank could consider bringing in Michael Hussey for Brendon McCullum (scheduled to fly back at the end of the league stage) or run the risk of the former Australian cricketer playing his first game of the season straight in the knockouts.

Probable XI:

Dwayne Smith, Brendon McCullum/Michael Hussey, Suresh Raina, Faf du Plessis, MS Dhoni (c&wk), Pawan Negi, Dwayne Bravo, Ravindra Jadeja, Ravichandran Ashwin, Mohit Sharma, Ashish Nehra.

Stats and Trivia:

- Glenn Maxwell scored 71 runs off 27 balls against R Ashwin in IPL 2014 at a strike-rate of 262.96.

- MS Dhoni is 83 short of recording 3000 IPL runs. He will become only the second CHN batsman, after Suresh Raina, to achieve the feat.

Quotes:

"The most important thing is that we don't chop and change the team. We try and stick to a core of players. Therefore the camaraderie and the team unity is there and that's most important."

- Dwayne Bravo reiterates CHN's success-mantra

"I have made my India debut but I can't just sit on that. I would like to continue being part of the team. So the IPL is important to me from that point of view as well. And then, the World T20 is also there, so in that sense too, performing well in the IPL is important"

- Axar Patel talks about the importance of keeping up the good performances.
Teams:

Chennai (From): Brendon McCullum, Dwayne Smith, Suresh Raina, Faf du Plessis, MS Dhoni(c/w), Pawan Negi, Dwayne Bravo, Ravindra Jadeja, Ravichandran Ashwin, Ishwar Pandey, Mohit Sharma, Ashish Nehra, Baba Aparajith, Matt Henry, Mithun Manhas, Samuel Badree, Ronit More, Michael Hussey, Rahul Sharma, Kyle Abbott, Ankush Bains, Irfan Pathan, Pratyush Singh, Andrew Tye, Eklavya Dwivedi

Punjab (From): Manan Vohra, Murali Vijay, Wriddhiman Saha(w), Glenn Maxwell, David Miller, George Bailey(c), Gurkeerat Singh Mann, Axar Patel, Beuran Hendricks, Anureet Singh, Sandeep Sharma, Rishi Dhawan, Karanveer Singh, Parvinder Awana, Shardul Thakur, Shivam Sharma, Thisara Perera, Virender Sehwag, Nikhil Naik, Yogesh Golwalkar
